humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest tumor size is 2.3 cm, which falls within the range for a T2 tumor (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by the in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. Tumor size is used to determine the T stage, even when the histological type is Medullary Adenocarcinoma, so the T stage is still T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the invasive ductal carcinoma measures 2.3 cm in largest dimension, which falls within the T2 category (T2: Tumor size >2 cm but ≤5 cm). Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
